Class Settings

java.lang.Object
Settings
public class Settings extends Object
The Setting class manages a setting window that enables user to configure preferences and start the game via creating a new Game instance.

  • Constructor Details

    • Settings

      public Settings()

  • Method Details

    • configSettings

      public void configSettings(int wordLength, String wordSource, String[] wordLengthOptions, String[] wordSourceOptions)
      This method configs the setting window at the very beginning and should be called before being set visible.
      Parameters:
      wordLength - an int describing the length of words to be guessed.
      wordSource - a String describing the specific source type, included in wordSourceOptions.
      wordLengthOptions - a String array containing the word lengths to be chosen.
      wordSourceOptions - a String array containing the word sources to be chosen.

    • getInstance

      public static Settings getInstance()
      Returns an instance of current class, where only one copy of instance will exist.

      If no instance found, a new one will be generated and stored. Otherwise, the stored one will be return.

      Returns:
      an instance of current class.

    • getWordSource

      public static String getWordSource()
      Returns the word source selected by the user.
      Returns:
      a String describing the word source selected by the user.

    • getInitWord

      public static String getInitWord()
      Returns the initial word typed by the user.
      Returns:
      a String describing the initial word typed by the user.

    • getCurrentHashtag

      public static String getCurrentHashtag()
      Returns current hashtag.
      Returns:
      a String describing current hashtag.

    • setVisibleStatus

      public void setVisibleStatus(Boolean status)
      This method sets the window to the center and makes it change its visible status
      Parameters:
      status - a boolean describing the intended visible status of the window.

    • textInit

      public static JTextField textInit(String content, String fontName, int alignment, int fontStyle, int x, int y, int width, int height, int fontSize, boolean opaqueStatus, boolean editable)
      This static method returns a configured JTextField.
      Parameters:
      content - a String describing the name of the text field.
      fontName - a String describing the name of the font.
      alignment - an int describing the alignment of the words of the text field.
      fontStyle - an int describing the font style of the text field.
      x - an int describing the new horizontal or x-coordinate of the text field.
      y - an int describing the new vertical or y-coordinate of the text field.
      width - an int describing the horizontal size of the text field.
      height - an int describing the vertical size of the text field.
      fontSize - an int describing the font size of the text field.
      opaqueStatus - a boolean describing the opaque status of the text field.
      editable - a boolean describing the editable status of the text field.
      Returns:
      a configured JTextField.

    • initButton

      public static JButton initButton(String content, int x, int y, int xSize, int ySize, int fontSize, ActionListener event)
      This static method returns a configured JButton.
      Parameters:
      content - a String describing the content displayed on the button.
      x - an int describing the new horizontal or x-coordinate of the button.
      y - an int describing the new vertical or y-coordinate of the button.
      xSize - an int describing the horizontal size of the button.
      ySize - an int describing the vertical size of the button.
      fontSize - an int describing the font size of the button.
      event - an ActionListener that will be called if the button is pressed.
      Returns:
      a configured JButton.
